title: Request to make older versions (zip, no-admin) install available

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I posted my question at Stackoverflow, but, there are already other question exactly like this over there since Feb 20, **2017** with no answer! So, it is definitely a *BUG* if you see by an user point view!

Please see it [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42353255/how-to-download-older-version-of-vscode-portable) and mine [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52810019/where-we-can-get-older-versions-of-vscode-like-1-25-in-zip-format).

I just cant see **why** MS dont use coherency in somethings. If a new VSCode is launched, it is made available in Source Code, Portable and Exe formats. But if we need an older version, only Source Code and Exe is available? Is there **any** logic on it?

Just to make it clear: I love VSCode. I just dont love MS. But I need it for Win64 because I have to use it in my work where I dont have admin privileges. (Linux at home).

Thank you.

title: Clear Editor Selection When Find Widget Is Closed
body:
(I Submited a PR for this. Resubmiting now with tests)

This causes the editor selection to be cleared, when the Find
widget is closed.  The cursor will be placed at the beginning of
where the selection was before it was cleared.

The purpose of this change is to mitigate the inconvenient assumption
that all searches will result in a need to type over the searched text,
which seems to rarely be the case.  Currently, if a person wishes to exit
the Find widget after performing a search, they will need to type the
escape keystroke once to close the Find widget.  Then, they will
need to type the escape keystroke again to clear the highlighted
selection from the search.

title: The image of the window appears distorted with last version of VSCode
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.28.1
- OS Version: Hackintosh OSX Yosemite 10.10.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. A clean install of VSCode
2. Open any file with some text and image is distorted in VSCode window

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: NO

#### Problem
Hi, I just installed the latest stable version of __Visual Studio Code 1.28.1__ completely clean on my __Hackintosh with OSX Yosemite 10.10.5__ and __GeForce GT 230 graphics card__ and the image of the window appears distorted as shown in the attached image.

![system_info](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5801847/46914504-04147780-cf9f-11e8-8575-c1cbd55c1c8a.png)

![vs_code_render_chunks](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5801847/46914507-0d9ddf80-cf9f-11e8-804d-29f7e883df51.png)

In the past something similar happened to me with Chrome 55 and the technical team told me that the temporary solution could be to disable the __hardware acceleration__ of the rendering through one of the Chrome settings until they solve the problem as it seems that they have already do.

_Is there a similar option in Visual Studio Code to solve this problem?_

title: Find in selection is not auto-enabled when any text is selected
body:
- VSCode Version:1.28.1
- OS Version:Win 10

Previously ( <1.28) find would auto-enable "find in selection" only when the selection spanned multiple lines.  It now appears to do so if any text is selected.  This make pre-population of the search text not as useful as it now limits the search to the selection.  Please revert to previous state where "find in selection" defaults to enabled only on multi-line selection

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select a word (double click word)
2. Start find (ctrl-f)
3. Note that "find in selection" is enabled

title: Open next build error file+line based on regex parsing of build output.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Edit: The proposed ability to jump to first/next build error should not be part of the "Problems" explorer system, since this requires code analysis. **The command should be based solely on regex parsing of the build output, and should work in absence of any language support aka extensions.** I shouldn't have to run 300mb and jvm in the background just to jump to build errors.

When I run a build task to compile my code, I would like a keyboard shortcut that will open the location of the first/next compile error by opening the file and jumping to the line.

This command should ignore non build related errors and warning (from linters / intellisense). I am not interested in general VSCode problem noise, I just want to be able to quickly and easily address compile errors. 

It should start at the first compile error in the terminal, and cycle from there. Basically, just go see how all other editors in the world jump to build errors with a shortcut.....do that.

Its a pretty basic and necessary feature.

1. Hit build.
2. Jump to error....

The problems view is not adequate.

**1. It requires the language support plugin to be installed.** This is totally unnecessary, as regex parsing of the build output is simpler, lighter, and tried tested and true.  

**2 It is more than a single hotkey press.** In sublime when I build, I press a single shortcut to jump to error, then I fix error, I press a single shortcut to jump to next error....rinse and repeat.

In VSCode I...
-press a shortcut to focus problems
-I press down to highlight error
-I press ENTER to focus editor and the fix error
-I press shortcut to focus problems view again

Its so much more work! 

**3. It does not cycle problems in order.** This is important, as when compiling, often the first build error is also causing the subsequent errors.

**4. It contains "problems" and not build errors.** Its cute that VSCode has this concept of "problems", and that it is telling me what is wrong with my code...but I don't care about that noise. Either its a compiler error, or I don't care. I just want the compiler errors, and I want them in order.

VSCode has somehow made this way too complicated.

title: When using SHIFT + TAB, all the line goes left, whereas in VS or SSMS only the tabs between the words are removed
body:
I asked this for AzureDataStudio but they said it is a VSCODE issue

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Opening a file
2.Write [Tab][Tab]Select[Tab]COLUMN1,[Tab][Tab]COLUMN2
3.Put the cursor before COLUMN2
4.Do SHIFT + TAB

Expected result : the [Tab] near COLUMN2 is removed
[Tab][Tab]Select[Tab]COLUMN1,[Tab]COLUMN2

Current result : the [Tab] at the beginning of the line is removed
[Tab]Select[Tab]COLUMN1,[Tab][Tab]COLUMN2

Also, I used these settings : 
    "editor.detectIndentation": false,
    "editor.insertSpaces": false

The expected result is what happens in Visual Studio or SSMS.
Can you add a setting to get this behavior ?

title: createFileSystemWatcher API not fired when parents renamed
Improve ui/ux when debugging with multiple configurations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I am often debugging both an extension and attaching to an lsp server and I find the current ui/ux frustrating when constantly switching between them. Having to use the dropdown on the Debug sidebar to switch between running the extension vs attaching to the lsp server is imo less than ideal.

I would love to see something like the following (one or more of them):
1. a way of defining shortcut keys to launch specific configs (ideally per workspace)
1. a way to make a config(s) the default (like tasks) -- so that F5 would ALWAYS run that config, and if there were more than 1 default, it would open a quickpick with the set of defaults (again just like build tasks when you hit Ctrl+Shift+B)
1. in lieu of the default above, another option would be a way to start a launch config without switching the selected launch config -- e.g. I start debugging the extension (so the dropdown is the extension), then I want to attach to the lsp server so I run something like `workbench.action.debug.selectandstart` but it *shouldn't* change the selection. So that when I stop debugging and I hit F5 again, it runs the extension rather than attaching to a not running lsp server.
1. Coupled with the one above, would be nice to be able to have F5, if the debugger wasn't paused (BP or otherwise), open a quickpick of launch configs (not by default, but something that can be made to happen via custom shortcut configuration)

Thoughts?

title: Problems view filter: Extend capabilities

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Extend problem view filter capabilities:
    - Enable to exclude errors, warnings, info messages by writing !error, !warning, !info,
    - Enable to exclude or show only specific messages by writing <!>error/<!>warning/<!>info**:**<Message patern that starts with defined text or has defined text in the message>
    - Enable to stack filter options. If we want to exclude info messages, warnings that have text, for example,  directive and errors that start with, for example, undefined, then we could write like this: !info, !warnings:directive, !error:^undefined
    - Add possibility to mix show only message and exclude messages. Example: info, !info:[cSpell checker]. In this example only info messages are shown that do not starts with [cSpell checker].

title: nextMatchFindAction inherits addSelectionToNextFindMatch match word setting
body:
I would like to have a setting which would enable _nextMatchFindAction_ to inherit the matchCase+matchWord of the  addSelectionToNextFindMatch (ctrl+d) command.

Something like... **findActionInheritsSelectionMatchWord**.

**Current Behaviour:**

The _addSelectionToNextFindMatch_ command automatically sets the matchCase&matchWord settings, based on the selection type.

**Example A1**
1-press ctrl+d _addSelectionToNextFindMatch_ with the caret at the front of the word to select the word.
2-press ctrl+d _addSelectionToNextFindMatch_  again. The matchCase&matchWord are automatically turned on for this second ctrl+d.

**Example A2**
1-select a word by any means other than ctrl+d _addSelectionToNextFindMatch_. (ctrl+shift+left\right)
2-press ctrl+d _addSelectionToNextFindMatch_ . The matchCase&matchWord are automatically turned off for this second ctrl+d.

I would like the exact same behavior, but with the second step based on nextMatchFindAction. Observe...

**Proposed Behaviour:**

**Example B1**
1-press ctrl+d _addSelectionToNextFindMatch_ with the caret at the front of the word to select the word.
2-press F3 _nextMatchFindAction_. The matchCase&matchWord are automatically turned on for this _nextMatchFindAction_.

**Example B2**
1-select a word by any means other than ctrl+d _addSelectionToNextFindMatch_. (ctrl+shift+left\right)
2-press F3 _nextMatchFindAction_. The matchCase&matchWord are automatically turned off for this second _nextMatchFindAction_.

The command _moveSelectionToNextFindMatch_ might be suggested, but it does not solve my problem, since it does not remember the last search term.

For example...

**Example C1**
1-I press ctrl+d to select a whole variable.
2-I press F3 a bunch of times to observe how variable is used (say view the first 10 of 20 instances.
3-I then stop and type in some code, removing any selection.
4-I then press F3 again, to pick up where I left off browsing through all uses of a variable (second 10 instances.

In this example _moveSelectionToNextFindMatch_ fails, since I removed by selection at step 3, and at step 4 nothing will happen. I would have to navigate back to the instance of a variable, and re-initiate the selection.

title: `extensions/extension-editing/src/extensionLinter.ts` does not respect `repository` shorthand in package.json
body:
VS Code warns about non-https relative image links in markdown files, with this message:

> Relative image URLs require a repository with HTTPS protocol to be specified in the package.json.

If I update package.json to include a repository with an HTTPS URL, this warning goes away:

```json
"repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/user/repo"
}
```

However, there are [other ways](https://docs.npmjs.com/files/package.json#repository) to specify a repository url. For example:

    "repository": "github:user/repo"

In this case, the "repository" link will point to https://github.com/user/repo. But the extension-linter does not detect this case, and still shows the warning.




<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. --> 
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.28.0 (user setup)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new GitHub project, and add a new VS Code extension to the repository.
2. In `package.json`, specify the `repository` as `"repository": "github:user/repo"`.
3. In `README.md`, reference an image by its relative path.
4. Open out the "problems" tab in VS Code.

Expected: No problems are reported.
Actual: `extension-linter` reports the warning `Relative image URLs require a repository with HTTPS protocol to be specified in the package.json.`

5. Change the `repository` property's value to:

```json
"repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/user/repo"
}
```

Expected: No problems are reported.
Actual: Behaves as expected (no problems are reported).


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: **Yes**/No

title: Show column numbers in vscode
body:
Hey all. I recently discovered that in the "Go to Line" command, you can not only go to a specific line, but you can also go to a specific column within that line. 

So for instance, `Ctrl+G` + `10, 10` will move you to line 10, column 10 in the editor.

It would be nice for there to be an editor option that shows column numbers as well as line numbers within the editor, so that you don't have to guess which column to move to after the comma.

If this is already a feature that exists, my bad! I couldn't find it looking through the settings.

title: Multiroot: Automatic Generation of launch.json for node has wrong paths
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.28.1
- OS Version: 10.0.17763.55

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Clone https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-smoketest-express
2. Open VS Code
3. Add `public`, `routes`, and `views` to a _workspace_ (Don't open the root folder)
4. Open `index.js` from the `routes` root.
5. Press F5
6. Select Node in the debugger quick pick when it's shown
7. Message: Attribute 'program' does not exist ('F:\temp\smoke-test-repo\routes/routes\index.js').
8. Select open launch.json, and select node again to see the generated file

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Expected behaviour:
`launch.json` is generated, with the `program` attribute as follows: `"program": "${workspaceFolder}\\index.js"`

Actual Behaviour:
`launch.json` is generated, with the `program` attribute as follows: `"program": "${workspaceFolder}/routes\\index.js"`

title: flutter/dart popup tooltips poorly positioned

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I am using flutter/dart in VS Code on Windows 7 SP1

```
flutter doctor
Doctor summary (to see all details, run flutter doctor -v):
[√] Flutter (Channel beta, v0.8.2, on Microsoft Windows [Version 6.1.7601], locale en-US)
[√] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK 27.0.3)
[√] Android Studio (version 3.1)
[√] VS Code, 64-bit edition (version 1.28.0)
[√] Connected devices (1 available)

• No issues found!
```

When I hover over a recognized object, a tooltip popup appears. A problem is that if the object over which I hover is close to the top of the screen, the tooltip appears too far up; its top contents are hidden; and I have to reposition the object lower on the screen.

The first image displays the tooltip positioning problem. I have hovered over **Column** (line 78) where **Column** is near the top of the screen.

![tooltip_too_high](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13719145/46751681-d965ae80-cc80-11e8-996b-01aae1a801b6.png)

The second image displays the tooltip when **Column** has been scrolled downward towards the center of the screen.

![tooltip_ok](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13719145/46751698-e4b8da00-cc80-11e8-92d3-b7bad99fe94a.png)

It appears that tooltips require 9 lines. So through simple computations, the tooltip could be placed so that all 9 lines of the tooltip appear near the object it is discussing without clipping.

title: Search kinda broken, automatically selecting current line when text is highlighted
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.28.0 (1.28.0)
- OS Version: macOs Sierra 10.12.6

After the update to Version 1.28.0 (1.28.0) when text is selected and using Find, the line is automatically highlighted and the search doesn't work as expected since it's only searching in the line where the cursor is. This is getting really tedious, since I usually select text->copy->find->paste the text. I could not reproduce this on a Windows installation.

Example: https://i.imgur.com/0zG0cEa.mp4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. select text
2. Find CMD+F

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Cleanup list/tree mouse & keyboard navigation

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
After discussing this with @bpasero, we've come up with the following steps for the list widget. Let's forget about the current tree widget as we'll soon kill it and the new one is built on top of the list

- [ ] Element focus should be an internal list concept (there should be no `setFocus` or `getFocus` methods). Interaction with the list should be configurable per device: mouse vs keyboard. The following two list options should be introduced:
  - `singleClickSelection` (defaults to `true`) will configure whether single clicking a tree element would set it to selection. Double click will always set it to selection.
  - `lightKeyboardNavigation` (defaults to `true`) will configure whether keyboard navigation would set elements to be focused vs. selected.
- [ ] When not using a keyboard controller, the list should add the set of focused elements to the keyboard event which will bubble to the outside.
- [ ] The keybinding service should forward that extra event information to the command which is about to execute. This way, list commands always have the correct context when running.
- [ ] The `List` selection events should forward the related browser events which caused those selection changes.
- [ ] The `WorkbenchList` is responsible for mapping **selection** events into **open** events. It should also expose a `open()` method which commands can call into.
- [ ] The `WorkbenchList` is also responsible for listening to the proper workbench configurations and configure the `List` accordingly.
- [ ] List/tree widget users should only rely on `open` events and forget about focus and selection altogether.
- [ ] All the `focusNext`, etc, calls should be renamed to `navigateNext`. The only remaining calls of those would be `getSelection()` and `setSelection()`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22350/46743105-a1726180-cca8-11e8-88f6-c856ed93eecc.png)

title: [html] proper support of XHTML

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
XHTML is parsed as HTML rather than as XML, which causes various issues:

- Self closing tags are not allowed, except for elements which in HTML are void elements.
- Elements which in HTML are void elements are allowed to be unclosed, and are unclosed by default.
- Elements which in HTML are void elements are not allowed to have a separate close tag.
- Attribute values are allowed to be omitted or unquoted.
